thread.title: Here’s what’s going on with the “day without immigrants” signs you keep seeing today
thread.title_full: Here’s what’s going on with the “day without immigrants” signs you keep seeing today

author: Brittany Malooly
title: Here’s what’s going on with the “day without immigrants” signs you keep seeing today
text:
Here’s what’s going on with the “day without immigrants” signs you keep seeing today To protest Donald Trump’s stance on immigration, many immigrants from around the U.S. today are skipping work, refraining from shopping, and in some cases keeping their children home from school to show just how essential immigrants are to this country. The protest is called the “day without immigrants,” and is already underway. The movement is in response both to the President’s Muslim ban , which is temporarily on hold, and his plan to build a wall between the United States and Mexico .
It’s unclear as of now how big the impact will be, but so far some of the images are POWERFUL.
Proud to stand with local restaurants and fellow immigrants in solidarity. Our little factory is closed today. #daywithoutimmigrants 
A post shared by Kika's Treats (@kikastreats) on Feb 16, 2017 at 10:37am PST 
In Staten Island, site of recent #ICERaids , many immigrant-owned stores have shut to join #DayWithoutImmigrants . pic.twitter.com/dbkbeCo7R1 
— Daniel Altschuler (@altochulo) February 16, 2017 According to the New York Times , Washington D.C., due to its proximity to Trump himself , is a hotspot for the protest today, with at least 12 restaurants closing completely.
Celebrity chef José Andrés says that, for him, the decision to shutter several of his restaurants for the day in solidarity with his employees was simple.
“It was a very easy decision,” Andrés told NPR in a recent interview . “When you have employees that have been with you almost 25 years, and they come to you in an organized way and they tell you, ‘Don’t get upset but Thursday we are not coming to work,’ [the] next thing you ask is, ‘What’s going on? What’s happening?’ So I decided to join them and support them — that’s what we’re doing.”
From The Austin American Statesman: Businesses across America are closing Thursday in protest as part of 'A Day Without Immigrants.' Here's a list of Austin restaurants closing, including some Tacodeli and Torchy's Tacos locations: http://atxne.ws/2kWkewc (Pictured: El Borrego de Oro at 3900 S. Congress Ave./Photo credit: April Riggs) #daywithoutimmigrants #resist #women4justice 
A post shared by WomenforJustice (@womenforjustice) on Feb 16, 2017 at 7:47am PST 
A #daywithoutanimmigrant in my class. #ESOL #ELL #ELA / Un #diasininmigrantes en mi clase. pic.twitter.com/PIdVRfk3z2 
— Lοrεna βυrroωs (@Burrows_AHS) February 16, 2017 Other cities that are expecting to see a substantial amount of immigrants participating include Los Angeles, New York, Austin, Boston, Chicago, and Philadelphia.
Here’s a photo of some of the protests:
Protestors have arrived TX Capitol in the hundreds, some dancing to blaring Cumbia music. #DayWithoutImmigrants pic.twitter.com/buWQXmAvle 
— Mark D. Wilson (@MDWilsonSA) February 16, 2017 #Repost @cthomasclt: ・・・ Charlotteans are on the move marching and honking for immigrant rights. #daywithoutimmigrants #knightcities . . . . . . . #Repost #daywithoutlatinos #daywithoutimmigrants #LatinByNature 
A post shared by LBN (@latinbynature) on Feb 16, 2017 at 11:03am PST 
✊✊✊ #DayWithoutImmigrants 
A post shared by Avilene Hernández Pérez (@avihndzz) on Feb 16, 2017 at 11:04am PST 
One particularly fiery sign from today reads, “While this may be an ‘inconvenience’ for some, it is nowhere near the ‘inconvenience’ that the current administration has caused for our good, hard-working brothers and sisters. Resist!”
#Repost @undocumedia with @repostapp ・・・ THISSS!!!! ☝ #realest Repost @atwoods_tavern ・・・ Proud to stand with our Immigrant brothers and sisters! See you tonight for @katwrightkatwright !! Bar opens at 3:30p for drinks. @atwoods_tavern #adaywithoutimmigrants #resist #DiaSinInmigrantes #NoNosVamos #HereToStay #DayWithoutImmigrants #ADayWithoutImmigrants 
A post shared by The Queers (@thequeercrowdslo) on Feb 16, 2017 at 11:02am PST 
We are proud that immigrants are taking a stand . We are more powerful together.
